document_data.name: ''Four Decades of Innkeeping''
document_data.author: [[Thundaerlel Maurlatrimm]]
document_data.Contents: Among other topics, Thundaerlel discussed Crown-chartered adventurers in his book. The innkeeper held a low opinion of the adventuring trade, calling them mischief-makers and brigands, responsible for pillaging, thefts, and casual murders. Despite that, he also thought adventurers were a necessary plague as they kept high priests, [[wizard]]s, and kings in check, as well as controlled populations of dangerous monsters.
